import styles from "./App.module.css"; import NavBar from "./components/Nav/NavBar"; import FullWidthSection from "./components/FullWidthSection"; import CentralSection from "./components/CentralSection"; import BlackFade from "./components/BlackFade"; import CentralTile from "./components/CentralTile"; import tileStyles from "./components/CentralTile.module.css"; import greenerHomesPath from "./images/GH-journey-map.jpeg"; import netMeteringGraphic from "./images/netmetering_graphic_vertical.png"; import nabcepSeal from "./images/pv_assoc_seal.png"; function App() { return (
Residential solar installation

Pre-wiring and consultation

Off-grid and grid-tied applications

Solar Incentives
$5,000 Greener Homes Grant
The Canada greener homes grant provides Canadians with $1 per kW of Solar installed, up to a maximum of $5,000. To be eligible for the grant, you must own your home, and it must be your primary residence.
$40,000 Interest-Free Greener Homes Loan
In addition to the grant, the Greener Homes Program and the CMHC are offering loans of up to $40,000 for energy efficient Home retrofits

To be eligible for the Grant or the loan, homes must receive an energy efficiency inspection from an EnerGuide accredited company before any retrofits begin - We can help you get in touch with an EnerGuide certified inspector! See the Greener Homes Program roadmap for homeowners below:



Click{" "} HERE {" "} for more information about the Greener Homes Program
BC Net Metering
Through BC Hydro's Net Metering program, you can use the energy you produce with solar to offset your consumption from the grid!

For every kWh of energy you produce with solar, you receive a bill credit that you can use against your actual energy consumption at the end of the month. If you produce more from solar than you used that month, those credits carry over to the next month!

Accumulated credits carry over month to month until you hit you anniversary date (typically March), when any unused credits are reset to 0.
); } export default App;
